name: La Pudumai - A Crafts and Textile Exhibition by the Crafts Council of Puducherry
description:
Join us at Atta Galatta this festive season for a Crafts and Textile Exhibition by the Crafts Council of Puducherry. La Pudumai is an exclusively curated festive popup exhibition on Pondy crafts, textiles and more....
Find Eco lamp shades, Contemporary wood crafts, Pondy Marbled crafts, Tan buff leather bags & accessories, Kalamkari bags, Hand-painted sarees &  stoles, crochet decor items, candles and perfumeries, Hammock & handwoven bedspreads, ceramic stoneware pottery,Korai zari boxes & utility items, Upcycled newspaper crafts, exquisite wood blocks for printing,Kalahasti pen  Kalamkari sarees, Handlooms, Madhubani crafts from Jharkhand, Perawan Indigo hand dyed clothing Jaipur, Kiara handwoven bags, Titli Kalamkari kids wear brand Delhi,Pichhwai painting Rajasthan, Kerala Murali painting Wayanad, Palm leaf crafts from Kanyakumari and more- including chances to interact with the artisans in interactive activities and make your own crafts.

name: Coffee and Conversations - Group Meetup by The Listeners Circle
description:
What about some Filter Coffee and Unfiltered conversations on a fine Sunday morning?
Listeners Circle is an initiative to facilitate listening without judgment, hence giving a safe space for anyone to speak their heart out without the fear of judgment.
We at Listeners Circle are committed to building a community where there are no unsaid words, held back emotions and buried feelings because of the fear of being judged.
After 50+ Editions of Tell your Story, Listeners Circle relaunching a lighter format - Coffee and Conversations!
Coffee lightens us up. Coffee gives us clarity. Coffee refreshes up. Sip a coffee and speak your heart out without fear of judgment and listen without judging! Coffee is on us and the onus of conversation without judgment is on you.
Every word matters. Every emotion matters. Every feeling matters.
Think about how it would feel to take an hour out of your fast-paced life and share your experiences and thoughts to people who listen to you without judging over a cup of Coffee? Also, listen to others without judging.
Listeners` circle Coffee and Conversations -This is an event to make that happen.
Be a part of the Listener`s circle Coffee & Conversations - Edition 5.
Speak your mind without being judged. Speak your mind without any boundaries. No photography and videography without consent. Your stories stay within the four walls of the room and the hearts.
Would you like to just listen? We have a place for you too.
Book your passes in advance to avoid the last-minute sell outs.
Listeners Circle is an initiative to facilitate listening without judgment, hence giving a safe space for anyone to speak their heart out without the fear of judgment. We have done 50+ sessions over the last year, enabling people to voice their stories. Coffee & Conversations is our new format based on popular demand.

name: Sound Meditation - Workshop with Rohini C
description:
In today’s fast-paced world, our minds rarely get a chance to pause. Constant deadlines, endless notifications, and the pressure to perform can leave us feeling drained and disconnected.
Sound Meditation offers a simple yet powerful way to restore balance. Using soothing sound vibrations from instruments like singing bowls, chimes, and gongs, this practice helps you:

Calm your overactive mind 
Release stress and fatigue 
Improve focus and clarity 
Reconnect with your inner stillness

	Pay as you like!

name: Journal with Art – to Unwind for the Week - Journaling Workshop by Yukti Gtover
description:
Step into a gentle Friday evening space where words and colours come together to help you slow down, play, and reflect—without the weight of overthinking. In this 2-hour workshop, we’ll explore simple journaling prompts, mix in colours and doodles, and create pages that feel like breathing room on paper.
This isn’t about being “good” at art or journaling; it’s about showing up for yourself, expressing freely, and discovering how a blend of writing and art can lighten your week. All materials are included—bringing your own journal will make it extra special. You’ll carry home not just pages, but reflections that feel light yet precious, like tiny treasures of clarity.
📅 Friday, 19th September 2024
🕔 5:00 – 7:00 p.m.
📍 Atta Galatta, Indiranagar, Bangalore
💸 ₹449 (all fun art materials included)
Come as you are, unwind as you wish. ✨

name: Food In Literature - Monthly Book Club
description:
Our emotions and memories are intrinsically related to the food we eat and the genre of food literature combines them in a way that helps us connect not only to our past and our present, to different cultures, and communities, values and rituals, events both life-changing and mundane but to each other as well. So, if viewing the world through the lens of food and literature interests you, then join us for a dialogue on “Food in Literature” and to celebrate those stories and their diversity.
Each month with Prachi Grover, we read our way through several powerful (and delicious) narratives.
September Read: India’s Most Legendary Restaurants by Ruth Dsouza Prabhu
We assure you that you will enjoy every single bite!
Prachi Grover is a culinary consultant and educator and is the founder of “From Words to Wok”; a community for people who to love to read and eat!

name: Leave it to PG - Book Discussion with Lakshmi Sankar and Balu Ambedkar
description:
Sir Pelham Grenville Wodehouse, KBE, was a comic writer who enjoyed enormous popular success during a career of more than seventy years and continues to be widely read. P.GWodehouse is the master of taking things to a painful extreme in terms of humour. 
 Let's meet up and create a haven for like- minded souls. The idea is simply to discuss the Blanding series and share our reading anecdotes & enjoyment of it together. A nobleman excessively devoted to a pig is funny enough. But what about if the pig was to be stolen to protect it from another crazy nobleman who likes to throw eggs at the gardener? Let's add to the mayhem and literary chaos . Join us on 20th sept to discuss pigs, tea, peculiar family members and the eccentricities of aristocracy.

name: Once Upon a Laugh - Storytelling with Vivero Preschool
description:
Get ready for a day of stories and glee, 'ONCE UPON A LAUGH where fun is the key!
Kids can enjoy-

Creative Art Corner
Funky Photobooths
Music and Movement
And lots of Storytelling fun!

name: UnBridled - Book Launch by Divya K Unni
description: UnBridled, a collection of 73 poems, is a compelling narrative that explores the depths of personal and collective freedom and the courage to break boundaries. It is a cocktail of love, lust, longing, belonging, bereavement, betrayal, acceptance, childhood, nostalgia, and homecoming expressed in an unbridled female voice anchored on raw emotions and lyrical prowess. The poet serenades the readers into a world where strength is born from vulnerability.

name: The Bougainvillea Circle - Connection Circle by Radhika Ghose
description:
"Sawubona" a Zulu Greeting meaning, "We See You". At Bougainvillea Circles you are offered a space to be heard, seen, welcomed as you are. A non-judgmental, safe, trusted space where you are free to be all that you want to be. Nothing More, Nothing less. No Restrictions, no judgements, just an intimate group of people looking for a space to be real. A space where we`re all less alone for a little while. Where we are seen, how we want to be seen. Conversations, Connections, Community of Compassion. All that makes the world go round, after Love of course!
Remember - Sawubona: We See You.

name: An Evening of Verse and Voice - A celebration of Srividya Sivakumar’s Work
description:
Join us for an intimate celebration of a collection that Rochelle Potkar calls "a poetic vision that is simultaneously philosophical, political, and deeply personal," and that Vinita Agrawal says is "effulgent with some deep knowledge filtered from a profound wisdom about love, intimacy, womanhood, relationships and parting." 
We are talking about Srividya Sivakumar's new book of poetry, The Soundtrack of My Life - Side B.
Listen in as the poet reads from her work, shares some new pieces, and discusses the whys and why-nots of poetry. 
About the poets:
Poornima Laxmeshwar resides in Bangalore, India. Her books of poetry include ‘Anything but Poetry’ (Writers Workshop), ‘Thirteen’ - a chapbook, (Yavanika Press) and 'Strings Attached', (Red River). She is currently working on fiction and an upcoming prose poetry collection.
Poet, columnist, and speaker, Dr. Srividya Sivakumar has been a teacher-trainer for twenty-six years, and has published three collections of poetry – The Soundtrack of My Life – Side B, The Blue Note, and The Heart is an Attic.

name: AG Lit Sisters - Meetup by Dr. Chhavi
description:
Step into an afternoon of thrill, thought, and storytelling with Manu J, the author of the gripping new psychological thriller The Artist.
Born in Thiruvananthapuram, the capital of Kerala (God’s Own Country), Manu grew up fascinated by the world of stories, whether on the pages of books or on the silver screen. A voracious reader and lifelong movie buff, his imagination was shaped by everything from murder mysteries and science fiction to drama and fantasy.
By profession, Manu is one of India’s Top 40 Under 40 Data Scientists, teaching machines to do his job and uncover the hidden mysteries that numbers whisper. He often likens it to being a detective; solving puzzles and bringing clarity out of complexity. But when the screens dim, his creative world takes over. The Artist is his foray into weaving psychological suspense with the sharp instincts of a storyteller trained to observe patterns in both life and data.
Away from data sets and dark plotlines, Manu finds rhythm in music, joy in books, and balance in the company of friends and family. His unique perspective (part scientist, part artist) makes him a rare new voice in Indian literature.
At this AG Lit Sisters gathering, Manu will share:

The making of The Artist and his journey from data science to fiction writing.
How reading, cinema, and real-life mysteries shape his storytelling.
What it means to live between two worlds: logic and imagination.
Join us at Atta Galatta for an intimate, inspiring conversation with a storyteller who reminds us that both numbers and narratives hold secrets waiting to be uncovered

name: Draw Yourself as a Cartoon Character! - Character Drawing Workshop for Kids
description:
What if your child could see themselves… as a cartoon? 🎨👦👧
This fun and interactive workshop is perfect for kids above 5 years. Guided step-by-step, children will learn how to draw a cartoon version of themselves in a playful, creative environment. It’s not about being perfect—it’s about self-expression, imagination, and a whole lot of fun!
And here’s the best part: every child will receive a surprise gift—a personalized caricature badge of themselves to take home! 🎁 A keepsake they’ll cherish and proudly show off.
No prior drawing experience needed. Just bring your little artist with crayons or colour pencils (papers will be provided by us) and let them enjoy two hours of creativity and joy.

name: Let's Take up S-P-A-C-E - The Body Banter Club by Vimala
description:
We live in this world
Fat women are just lazy binge-eaters. Skinny men get called twigs. Muscular women get called manly. Shapely men are called feminine. Women with no visible curves are not desirable. It never ends, does it? No matter how we exist, someone will find a way to make you feel wrong. The Body Banter Club would like to address this problem, body shaming.
We invite you to offload your cringe stories in a trusting environment on a Sunday afternoon before your lunch plans.

name: stE=mc - Stem Workshop with Madhuri Katti
description:
Join in for an interactive experiment-led science session by physics educator and writer Madhuri Katti and some of her students. The goal of the session is to show young students and adults a different and engaging way of thinking about science, history of scientific ideas and its effects on everyday life, by exploring fundamental topics via simple home-experiments. The experiments will be of three parts:
- Fun with Forces: Explanation of the four fundamental forces of nature, and their effects. Demonstration of experiments with gravity and static electricity. 
- Magnets and Motors : construction of a simple motor with a battery, magnet, and copper wire. Discussion of electricity and magnetism.
- Playing with fluids: demonstrations of dynamics of fluids involving surface tension, and diffusion.
At the end, we hope to inspire the participants to be boldly curious and to recognise the importance of science in our everyday lives.
Age: 10+, with children under 12 needing to be accompanied by a parent

name: Bandana Upcycling Meetup - A soft circle by Surili
description:
Slow Fashion meets Mental Wellbeing
Join us for a Bandana Upcycling Meetup hosted by Soft Matter at Atta Galatta. A warm space to create, connect, and care. Together, we’ll customise our own bandanas using fabric, patches, colours, beads, and more. Whether you paint, embroider, or experiment freely, all materials will be provided. Alongside making, we’ll gently reflect on what habits we’re currently “upcycling” in our lives, and end by envisioning the kind of community we want to nurture. A Soft Circle to slow down, make friends, and grow healthy habits through creativity and care.

name: An Evening of Magic - Magic Show by Nakul Shenoy and Friends
description: An Evening of Magic is a most amazing magic show presented by `Nakul Shenoy & Friends’, featuring top entertainers and magic acts. Curated and hosted by the internationally-acclaimed mentalist Nakul Shenoy, each event in this series brings unique acts and performances by nationally and internationally acclaimed magicians, alongside some of the most notable up-and-coming stars of magic. This is an evening that is truly magical, and one you will want to experience many times over.

name: Let Poetry Be - Monthly Poetry Open Mic
description:
This monthly gathering will see poetry coming to life, through reading, music, art and any other forms of artistic expression, at Atta Galatta. Listeners and performers are all welcome
Event specifics & submission guidelines –
1. Theme - Free verse (any original work)
2. Works can be original or of other poets, performed live
3. All languages welcome
4. Participants can read to music (acoustic instrument/s), dramatise, use props & costumes
5. Each participant will enjoy 5 minutes of reading time
6. Kindly submit your poem and name to letpoetrybe@gmail.com on or before 24th July midnight. WE WILL NOT ACCEPT ATTACHMENTS OR LINKS. SUBJECT OF YOUR MAIL MUST READ AS 'Entry for -July LPB meet-up '
7. You may also send entries that are not related to the theme
8. The event will begin at 4pm sharp and will be held at Atta Galatta. Participants to report not later than 3:45 pm to hear about performance order and meet the host
9. For any further clarifications, write to us at letpoetrybe@gmail.com
 
You are now welcome to flood our inbox!

name: Sandhya Swaranjali - A Musical Offering at Dusk
description:
An Enchanting Evening of Ragas, Bollywood & Soulful Fusion
✨ As the sun sets, let the music rise.
Join us for an unforgettable evening where tradition meets contemporary, in Sandhya Swaranjali, a soulful musical offering at dusk. This unique concert features a captivating presentation of Evening Ragas blended beautifully with timeless Bollywood tunes and soul-stirring Coke Studio favorites.
🎤 Featuring:
Simran Senani on Vocals
Ram Mohan Rao on Harmonium
Prahlad Deshpande on Tabla
Ravi Teja on Guitar
Bringing together classical finesse and modern flair
🎼 What to Expect:
• Mesmerizing Evening Ragas performed live
• Iconic Bollywood melodies reimagined
• Powerful Coke Studio fusion tracks
• A serene ambiance to experience music at its purest

name: Literary Meet - Meetup by White Falcon Publishing
description:
This free event promises a day full of Word Games, a Quiz on Literature, Wall Art Making, a Panel Discussion, an Award Ceremony, and exciting Giveaways!
Registration is mandatory, so please RSVP by emailing marketing@whitefalconpublishing.com or filling out the form in bio.
 Don't miss this opportunity to network with fellow writers and readers who love the written word!
Looking forward to seeing you there!

name: Career Edge - Signing with Kaushik Mitra
description:
Kaushik Mitra is the vice president and CFO at PepsiCo India with over 30 years of experience across Tata group, GE, and Reckitt Benckiser. Drawing from a rich, three-decade-long global career, this book is a practical, no-nonsense guide to building a sustainable and fulfilling professional journey. Through relatable stories and hard-earned wisdom, the author demystifies the complexities of corporate life, offering insights across three pivotal areas of self-development, collaboration and building resilience to deliver results.
Join us for a meet and greet and get copies of the book signed!

name: Atta Galatta presents “Support Group” - Support Group by Nimesh George and Gokul R.
description:
Topic: Engagement in Loneliness
People make up big cities but what makes up people’s lives, hopefully not loneliness. Loneliness is an intensely painful state which arises out of lack of intimacy and connectedness. People from every walk2 of life, even those with social contacts or pursuing successful careers can experience sadness from absence of belongingness. This painful experience is felt in a myriad of contexts such as breakups, disagreeing families, fear of rejection, unrelatability, shyness and so on.
This support group has been constituted to bring people struggling with disconnectedness in various contexts together for a shared experience of comfort, belongingness, laughter, guidance and above all to break the cycle of sustained loneliness.
The support is being organized and moderated by Nimesh George Mphil PhD who is a practicing psychologist based in Bangalore. This session will be co-moderated by Nimesh George & Gokul R, who are both practising psychologists in Bangalore.

name: UTOPIA - A Debut Standup Comedy Solo Show - A Comedy Show by Ravi Gaikwad
description:
With a unique voice, as tongue-in-cheek as it is full of heart, in his debut solo, Ravi plans to take us all on a deeply personal journey through the messy, hilarious and strange realities of growing up Dalit, in and around Mumbai.
By blending sharp and unapologetic observational humour and unfiltered storytelling, the show tackles themes of caste, class, sex, love, feminism and more in the most hilarious and heartfelt ways imaginable.
So it's really a love letter to the complexities of life and with every punchline, emerges a version of the world as only Ravi can see it in his colourful imagination; and for one evening, you are all invited to drop by!”
